post.body: Who should I even follow on here???

Check out the [KickAssTorrents ZeroNet clone](http://127.0.0.1:43110/1LBr1dHoXvJAMjDgW8Wcg5kbCoKyJnzo6p/). I'm skeptical a 1 to 1 clone is even possible but I appreciate the effort to at least try. Cheers!
***[PLAY](http://127.0.0.1:43110/1PLAYgDQboKojowD3kwdb3CtWmWaokXvfp/) + [WebTorrent](https://github.com/feross/webtorrent) would make the ultimate ZeroNet killer app***.
If you want to link to ZeroNet using a proxy and not have to worry about the proxy going down some time in the future, use this "meta proxy": https://zero.acelewis.com
Favourites should be given priority seed status.
If ZeroNet got a [@Snowden](https://twitter.com/Snowden) endorsement it would blow the fuck up.

What are some things not allowed on the "clearnet", either through monopolistic regulation or outright censorship? I've come up with the following but could use some help coming up with a few more...

* Piracy sites that distribute warez/torrents.
* Gambling sites.
* Drug marketplaces.

I feel as though I'm missing a few themes.
In addition to "Everyone" and "Followed users", ZeroMe should have a "Trending" option that ranks posts by number of likes relative to time elapsed since posted.
React and ZeroNet were made for each other!

People should start registering novelty accounts on here and then post magnet links under the account. For example, if you're really into UFC you would post the latest fights or if you're into a particular show you could post all the latest episodes. Then all I have to do is follow users that post material I want to stay up to date on.

Here are some magnet links to my favourite (lesser known) science fiction movies. I'd love to hear suggestions from the ZeroME community! 

Man from Earth (1080p) - [magnet](magnet:?xt=urn:btih:d0b9ce5d13922967af70e8f2a0be1a10a85ddf62&dn=The+Man+from+Earth+%282007%29+1080p+BrRip+x264+-+YIFY&tr=udp%3A%2F%2Ftracker.leechers-paradise.org%3A6969&tr=udp%3A%2F%2Fzer0day.ch%3A1337&tr=udp%3A%2F%2Fopen.demonii.com%3A1337&tr=udp%3A%2F%2Ftracker.coppersurfer.tk%3A6969&tr=udp%3A%2F%2Fexodus.desync.com%3A6969) | [imdb](http://www.imdb.com/title/tt0756683/)

Moon (1080p) - [magnet](magnet:?xt=urn:btih:24d340b6ca51a47714c34b204982ab12892a8c34&dn=Moon+%282009%29+1080p+BrRip+x264+-+YIFY&tr=udp%3A%2F%2Ftracker.leechers-paradise.org%3A6969&tr=udp%3A%2F%2Fzer0day.ch%3A1337&tr=udp%3A%2F%2Fopen.demonii.com%3A1337&tr=udp%3A%2F%2Ftracker.coppersurfer.tk%3A6969&tr=udp%3A%2F%2Fexodus.desync.com%3A6969) | [imdb](http://www.imdb.com/title/tt1182345/)

Ex Machina (1080p) - [magnet](magnet:?xt=urn:btih:0393e1fd34e5084f2bcf146aa89edc66728e9d22&dn=Ex+Machina+2015+1080p+BRRip+x264+DTS-JYK&tr=udp%3A%2F%2Ftracker.leechers-paradise.org%3A6969&tr=udp%3A%2F%2Fzer0day.ch%3A1337&tr=udp%3A%2F%2Fopen.demonii.com%3A1337&tr=udp%3A%2F%2Ftracker.coppersurfer.tk%3A6969&tr=udp%3A%2F%2Fexodus.desync.com%3A6969) | [imdb](http://www.imdb.com/title/tt0470752/)

Dark City (1080p) - [magnet](magnet:?xt=urn:btih:413fdd1d34244421e0a79dd46e4e2f38e08f8aaf&dn=Dark.City.1998.Directors.cut.1080p.Bluray.DTS.x264-%5BETRG%5D&tr=udp%3A%2F%2Ftracker.leechers-paradise.org%3A6969&tr=udp%3A%2F%2Fzer0day.ch%3A1337&tr=udp%3A%2F%2Fopen.demonii.com%3A1337&tr=udp%3A%2F%2Ftracker.coppersurfer.tk%3A6969&tr=udp%3A%2F%2Fexodus.desync.com%3A6969) | [imdb](http://www.imdb.com/title/tt0118929/)

Contact (1080p) - [magnet](magnet:?xt=urn:btih:a5fe449b3067ff5e86b0130c52ad983d193a7745&dn=Contact.1997.1080p.BluRay.x264.anoXmous&tr=udp%3A%2F%2Ftracker.leechers-paradise.org%3A6969&tr=udp%3A%2F%2Fzer0day.ch%3A1337&tr=udp%3A%2F%2Fopen.demonii.com%3A1337&tr=udp%3A%2F%2Ftracker.coppersurfer.tk%3A6969&tr=udp%3A%2F%2Fexodus.desync.com%3A6969) | [imdb](http://www.imdb.com/title/tt0118884/)
I've been downloading lots of x265 HEVC lately and I'm totally blown away by the quality to size ratio! Too bad it's closed source with tons of licensing issues.
@Nofish: Links should open in a new tab --> `target="_blank"`
What do you guys think of [elementaryOS](https://elementary.io) as my first Linux install? I'm used to OSX so it seems like a natural fit.

If you liked Breaking Bad, I highly recommend checking out the new TV series [Fargo](http://www.imdb.com/title/tt2802850/). It has nothing to do with drugs but the cinematography reminds me of how Breaking Bad was done.

[Season 1 (1080p x265 HEVC)](magnet:?xt=urn:btih:7091a90ae6ba3d89c9643b514380e920f4c96590&dn=Fargo%20S01&tr=udp%3A%2F%2Fopen.demonii.com%3A1337&tr=udp%3A%2F%2F9.rarbg.me%3A2710%2Fannounce&tr=udp%3A%2F%2Fopen.demonii.com%3A1337%2Fannounce&tr=udp%3A%2F%2Ftracker.openbittorrent.com%3A80%2Fannounce&tr=udp%3A%2F%2Ftracker4.piratux.com%3A6969%2Fannounce&tr=http%3A%2F%2Fopen.acgtracker.com%3A1096%2Fannounce&tr=http%3A%2F%2Ftracker.aletorrenty.pl%3A2710%2Fannounce&tr=udp%3A%2F%2Ftracker.opentrackr.org%3A1337%2Fannounce&tr=udp%3A%2F%2Ftorrent.gresille.org%3A80%2Fannounce&tr=udp%3A%2F%2Ftracker.openbittorrent.com%3A80%2Fannounce&tr=udp%3A%2F%2Ftracker.leechers-paradise.org%3A6969%2Fannounce&tr=udp%3A%2F%2Fcoppersurfer.tk%3A6969%2Fannounce)
[Season 2 (1080p x265 HEVC)](magnet:?xt=urn:btih:6dfd39be4752c4d6743ce3c2a87e6bda8678995b&dn=Fargo%20S02&tr=udp%3A%2F%2Ftracker.opentrackr.org%3A1337&tr=http%3A%2F%2Ftracker.aletorrenty.pl%3A2710%2Fannounce&tr=udp%3A%2F%2Ftracker.coppersurfer.tk%3A6969&tr=http%3A%2F%2Fexplodie.org%3A6969%2Fannounce&tr=udp%3A%2F%2Fzer0day.ch%3A1337)

And please seed if you like it! :-)

comment.body: @Quadrangle: Done! :)
I think @mention notifications would be awesome.
@Sirenyc: Let users rank by number of seeds. That's my only wish at this point. :)
@Kaffie: True enough. WebTorrent adoption would probably have to happen on the clearnet first, and then propagate to ZN.
@Tkarita: Any idea why they changed up the protocol? Was there something fatally flawed with what already exists? Seems like a really bad idea to break compatibility if it can be avoided.
It's like that feeling I got when I started posting to internet bulletin boards back in the mid 90s. Freedom, wonder and this sense of infinite possibilities.
@Klaus Jónsson Zimmermann: Back in my day it took over an hour to download a single mp3 on a 56k modem. Damn kids.
@Klaus Jónsson Zimmermann: Darn. Try [contacting](https://www.reddit.com/user/_AceLewis) the dev. It may not be intentional.
@Truth: Yeah but I mean that has to happen before people put serious effort into solving the reputation problem ZN will inevitably have.
Incredible work @nofish - It's truly amazing what ZeroNet has become.
@Sirenyc: Regular internet.
@Kaffie: Yes! This needs to happen.
@theterminator: testing123
Holy shit... You programmed it to travel back in time! :P
@Lola: I'm jealous! You're in for a real treat.
@Dxtjgxz: They're magnet links I found on various torrent sites.
@Mynameislegion: Yup, I've seen 2001 and would recommend it to anyone reading this.
@Quadrangle: Some of the magnets I posted are from rarbg and others from tpb. I searched around for the best quality rips with a decent number of seeds.
@Nofish: Can the next update have [links](http://#) within comments?  :-)
How will you handle escrow?

I honestly think creating a marketplace is one of the most difficult things to create on ZeroNet and will open you up to lots of legal issues if your @Talnicrom identity can be tied back to your real identity. I mean, Ross Ulbricht got two consecutive life sentences. I would only consider doing this if there is a lot of potential money in it for you to justify taking that risk or if it's something you reeeeaaaaally believe in philosophically.

@Edantes: I'm pretty sure the JavaScript exploit needs to be inserted by the site owner. So the hacker will bait the owner into visiting a site with said JavaScript exploit. This situation can be easily avoided by using a separate computer for *only* publishing sites to ZeroNet.
@Testset: Yup! My favourite was the second episode with the people who had to work for points to make it on reality TV. Really wonderful social commentary.
How do I ignore a user on here now?

My biggest gripe with x265 right now is Apple's lack of support for it. Apparently the A8 chip in aTV4 has hardware decoding but Apple hasn't enabled it due to licensing issues with the patent holder. I'm really hoping they enable it with a future firmware update once they start pushing 4K videos on iTunes. Fingers crossed!
